RelatedSentence: THE Ukraine crisis recalls 1914 before the outbreak of the First World War as Russia , the US and European governments risk sleepwalking into conflict , says former German chancellor Helmut Schmidt .
THE Ukraine crisis recalls 1914 before the outbreak of the First World War as Russia , the US and European governments risk sleepwalking into conflict , says former German chancellor Helmut Schmidt .

I do n't want to encourage a third world war , and especially not calls for more money for arms for Nato ( the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation ) , Mr Schmidt , 95 , was quoted as saying in an interview with Germany 's Bild newspaper .

I do n't want to encourage a third world war , and especially not calls for more money for arms for Nato ( the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation ) , Mr Schmidt , 95 , was quoted as saying in an interview with Germany 's Bild newspaper .

Mr Schmidt , who was chancellor from 1974 to 1982 , and fellow Social Democrat Gerhard Schroeder , who held the post from 1998 to 2005 , have warned against imposing sanctions on Russia and against moves by the European Union ( EU ) and Nato to forge closer ties with Ukraine .

Mr Schmidt , who was chancellor from 1974 to 1982 , and fellow Social Democrat Gerhard Schroeder , who held the post from 1998 to 2005 , have warned against imposing sanctions on Russia and against moves by the European Union ( EU ) and Nato to forge closer ties with Ukraine .
The interventions by past chancellors highlight the dilemma in Germany over how to deal with Russia .

Chancellor Angela Merkel , a Christian Democrat who grew up in communist East Germany and rules with the Social Democratic Party ( SPD ) as junior partner , has taken a harder line in threatening to intensify EU sanctions if Ukraine 's May 25 elections are disrupted .

RelatedSentence: In a March 26 interview with Die Zeit newspaper , Mr Schmidt was quoted as saying that Russia 's actions in Crimea were understandable and the situation in Ukraine was dangerous because the US and Europe are getting so terribly worked up .
